member.returns: True if the listener handled the event. It is considered an error by the System.Windows.WeakEventManager handling in WPFÂ to register a listener for an event that the listener does not handle. Regardless, the method should return false if it receives an event that it does not recognize or handle.

member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of a resulting object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the distance of the object to the point from which the search is started. This field allows sorting multiple results according their (ascending) distance order.
member.value: Distance of the object to the search point.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Gadgets.ILayerGeoSearch
member.summary: Collection of geographical search methods for layer objects.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Gadgets.ILayerGeoSearch.NearestSearch(System.Windows.Point,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Search for layer objects which reside nearest to a point specified in .
member.param: Point used as 'kick-off' of this search.
Maximal number of results to look for.

Flag indicating that the sorted list can exceed the maximal number of elements, when one or more objects exist having the same distance as the element at the position. Especially when only the nearest object should be returned ( equals 1), all objects at the same location should be returned too.
Delimiter for reducing the search area, commonly used to improve performance.
member.returns: Collection of nearest layer objects, provided with additional distance information.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Gadgets.ILayerGeoSearch.NearestSearch(System.Windows.Point,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Search for layer objects nearest to a point specified in .
member.param: Point used as 'kick-off' of this search.
Minimal number of results to look for. This parameter acts as a delimiter for terminating the search.
Maximal number of results to look for.

Flag indicating that the sorted list can exceed the maximal number of elements, when one or more objects exist having the same distance as the element at the position. Especially when only the nearest object should be returned ( equals 1), all objects at the same location should be returned too.
member.returns: Collection of nearest layer objects, provided with additional distance information.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Gadgets.ILayerGeoSearch.RectangleSearch(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle)
member.summary: Search for layer objects contained inside the rectangle specified in the parameter.
member.param: Rectangle used to search for all layer objects contained in it.
member.returns: Collection of layer objects, located inside the specified rectangle.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Gadgets.ILayerGeoSearch.EllipseSearch(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle)
member.summary: Search for layer objects contained inside the ellipse specified in the parameter.
member.param: Bounding rectangle of an ellipse used to search for all layer objects contained in it.
member.returns: Collection of layer objects, located inside the specified ellipse.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Gadgets.ILayerGeoSearch.PolygonSearch(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Windows.Point})
member.summary: Search for layer objects contained inside the polygon specified in the parameter.
member.param: Collection of points defining a polygon, which is used to search for all layer objects contained in it.
member.returns: Collection of layer objects, located inside the specified polygon.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Gadgets.ILayerGeoSearch.IntersectionSearch(System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Search for layer objects cut by the line defined by the points and . Especially for point objects, its part of the layer specification, when an object is regarded as 'cut' by a line.
member.returns: Collection of layer objects, which are cut by the specified line.

member.summary: Gets or sets a property which controls if Mouse.PreviewMouseUpEvents forward the focus to the map or not. If set to , every mouse click on the gadget or one of its children sets the focus to the map. The focus can still be retained if it is set e.g. by using the 'tab' key if 'KeyboardFocusBehavior' is set to 'Retain'.
member.value: FocusBehaviorMode which defines whether PreviewMouseUpEvents forward the focus to the map.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value which controls if Keyboard.PreviewKeyDownEvents forward the focus to the map or not. If set to every key press on the gadget or one of its children sets the focus to the map. As a result the gadget and all of its children is not able to gain the focus any more.
member.value: FocusBehaviorMode which defines whether PreviewKeyDownEvents forward the focus to the map.

member.summary: Clicking in the map starts a panning. If the mouse button is clicked and the mouse is moved, the map is panned. This means that the map is moved by the amount of the mouse move.

member.summary: Clicking in the map starts a zoom selection. If the mouse button is clicked and the mouse is moved, a rectangle is shown. When releasing the mouse, the map is zoomed to this rectangle.

member.summary: The same as Select, but the Shift button has to be pressed for select, otherwise the map is panned.

summary.para: This class represents a symbol on the map. Since a symbol cannot adapt its size and position according to the map scale by default, this class acts as a wrapper which extends this functionality. So it is responsible for placing the symbol at the appropriate coordinates and change its size according to the current map scale.
DO NOT SET DIRECTLY THE WIDTH AND THE HEIGHT OF THE MapIcon!!! SET THESE PROPERTIES DIRECTLY ON THE WRAPPED UserControl INSTEAD!!!
See the topic for an example.

member.name: F:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Shapes.ShapeCanvas.ScaleFactorProperty
member.summary: The ScaleFactor element defines the dependency between map scale and the size of map objects. A scale factor of 0 indicates a constant object size. The size of the map object is the size in pixel, without regarding the zoom factor. A scale factor of 1 indicates an object size in coordinate units. The object will be enlarged if the map is zoomed. It is also possible to choose a value between 0 and 1. According to that value, a nonlinear enlargement will be used.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Shapes.ShapeCanvas.GetScaleFactor(System.Windows.UIElement)

member.param: Shape element of which the scale factor should be retrieved.
member.returns: Shape element scale factor. Returns 0 if none was set.

New scale factor of the shape element.

Itâs also possible to choose a value between 0 and 1. According to that value, a nonlinear enlargement will be used.

members.member:
A layer which draws a bitmap overlay on the current map section.
UntiledLayer uses some basic hit testing for finding tool tips and it displays the descriptions returned from xMap Server, sometimes in a slightly modified way. When using UntiledLayer, you may want to look at:
- implements the basic hit test on information objects. Elements within a range of 10 pixels (measured taking either the reference point or the full response geometry into account - depending on what actually is available) qualify for tool tip display. Depending on the xMap content requested you may want to change this behavior. can be overridden in derived classes.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmsLayer
member.summary: Customized layer type, which is capable of integrating Web Map Services (WMS) into the map control.
member.remarks: Coordinate reference systems different from the PTV Mercator format can be integrated, because a reprojection is transformed to map these reference systems to the internally used format.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmsLayer.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new layer which integrates the images provided by Web Map Services into the map control.
member.param:
URL needed for retrieving images from the corresponding Web Map Service. The layout of this URL must achieve the requirements according the OpenGIS Specification, details can be found in http://www.opengeospatial.org/standards/wms .
Because the visible region of a map control changes during a user session, and the size in pixel may vary, some parameters in the URL query string have to be parameterized. I.e. the parameters 'BBOX', 'WIDTH' and 'HEIGHT' must be used in a parameterized way: They have to look like: ..&BBOX=${boundingbox}&WIDTH=${width}&HEIGHT=${height}.."
Indicating if a tiled variant is used for filling the map control with content, or not.

Indicating if the content represents a background information which completely fills the drawing area of the map control (= true), or only punctual information is shown (= false). This value influences the sequence order when the different layers are drawn.
Name of the layer in the internal layer management.
Copyright text visible in the lower right corner of the map control.
Longest time waiting for WMS request.

URL needed for retrieving images from the corresponding Web Map Service. The layout of this URL must achieve the requirements according the OpenGIS Specification, details can be found in http://www.opengeospatial.org/standards/wms .
Because the visible region of a map controls changes during a user session, and the size in pixel may vary, some parameters in the URL query string have to be parameterized. I.e. the parameters 'BBOX', 'WIDTH' and 'HEIGHT' must used in a parameterized way: They have to look like: ..&BBOX=${boundingbox}&WIDTH=${width}&HEIGHT=${height}.."
Longest time waiting for WMS request.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.LruCache`2
member.summary: Implements a very simple, size-restricted and thread safe LRU cache for caching arbitrary elements.
member.typeparam: Type of the key that identifies elements.
Type of the elements store in the LRU cache.

member.name: F:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.LruCache`2.dict
member.summary: Dictionary that stores our elements and maps keys to elements.

member.name: F:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.LruCache`2.list
member.summary: Linked list that reflects the LRU order of our elements.

member.name: F:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.LruCache`2.itemSize
member.summary: A function that calculates the size of an element. See constructor.

member.name: F:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.LruCache`2.limit
member.summary: The size limit of the LRU cache.

member.name: F:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.LruCache`2.size
member.summary: The current size of the LRU cache.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.LruCache`2.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Func{`1,System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates and initializes an instance of the LRU cache.
member.param: Size limit of the LRU cache.

Optionally provides the function to calculate the size of an element. If the size of the LRU cache is to be restricted simply by the number of elements, the size function should return a constant value of "1". This is also the default that is used in case the size parameter is set to null. If you want to limit the LRU cache by a real size, use the size function to return the byte size of an element.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.LruCache`2.Item(`0)
member.summary: Reads and writes elements using the key of an element.
member.param: Element key. Trying to read not existing elements results in a null value being returned - no exception will be thrown in that case. Writing elements with an existing key will update the value in the cache. Every element access will make this element the "least recently used" one. The implementation is thread safe using a synchronization lock on the inner dictionary.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.ReprojectionTileProvider
member.summary: Provider that is capable to produce tiles given a MapService that in turn is capable to render map sections in a specific CRS that differs from EPSG:76131. The ReprojectionTileProvider will internally use a ReprojectionService to wrap MapService. This ReprojectionService is used to "map" the MapService's CRS to PTV Mercator using image reprojection.

Additional options that are passed to the ReprojectionService. Optional, defaults to null.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.WmtsLayer
member.summary: A layer which draws geographic content based on Web Map Tile Services (WMTS) by means of pre-rendered or run-time computed geo-referenced map tiles. For its major object only two resources are needed: An URL template for addressing each individual tile and a customized classification of the different zoom levels for which tiles have to be generated for.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.WmtsLayer.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.TileMatrixSet)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The unique name of the layer.

Template of an URL which is needed for addressing individual tiles by means of placeholders for x, y and z (zooming level) parameters. As a typical representative the following template can be used: http://laermkartierung1.eisenbahn-bundesamt.de/mapproxy/wmts/ballungsraum_wmts/wmtsgrid/{z}/{x}/{y}.png

WMTS uses a tile matrix set to split the map into equal sized squares at different zoom levels. Such a square (so-called tile) is a matrix image which contains geographic data. So a map is cut into multiple tiles according to a fixed scale, which is called a tile matrix. Multiple matrices can be defined for different resolutions, resulting in a tile matrix set composed of one or more tile matrices. Each tile matrix uses a tile matrix identifier, commonly the position of the matrix in the set, the layer with the lowest resolution to be Layer 0. Further details can be seen here. The used tile matrix set by a service can be determined via the WMTS capabilities request. In the example shown for URL template the following tile matrix set was extracted from the capabilities http://laermkartierung1.eisenbahn-bundesamt.de/mb3/WMTSCapabilities.xml:
new TileMatrixSet("EPSG:25832") { new TileMatrix("00", 12980398.9955000000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 1, 1), new TileMatrix("01", 6490199.4977700000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 2, 2), new TileMatrix("02", 3245099.7488800000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 4, 4), new TileMatrix("03", 1622549.8744400000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 7, 8), new TileMatrix("04", 811274.9372210000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 14, 16), new TileMatrix("05", 405637.4686100000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 28, 32), new TileMatrix("06", 202818.7343050000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 56, 64), new TileMatrix("07", 101409.3671530000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 111, 128), new TileMatrix("08", 50704.6835763000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 222, 256), new TileMatrix("09", 25352.3417882000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 443, 512), new TileMatrix("10", 12676.1708941000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 885, 1024), new TileMatrix("11", 6338.0854470400, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 1770, 2048), new TileMatrix("12", 3169.0427235200, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 3540, 4096), new TileMatrix("13", 1584.5213617600, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 7080, 8192), new TileMatrix("14", 792.2606808800, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 14160, 16384), new TileMatrix("15", 396.1303404400, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 28320, 32768), new TileMatrix("16", 198.0651702200, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 56639, 65536), new TileMatrix("17", 99.0325851100, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 113278, 131072), new TileMatrix("18", 49.5162925550, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 226555, 262144), new TileMatrix("19", 24.7581462775, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 453109, 524288) };

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.WmtsLayer.UrlTemplate
member.summary: Template of an URL which is needed for addressing individual tiles by means of placeholders for x, y and z (zooming level) parameters. As a typical representative the following template can be used: http://laermkartierung1.eisenbahn-bundesamt.de/mapproxy/wmts/ballungsraum_wmts/wmtsgrid/{z}/{x}/{y}.png

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.WmtsLayer.TileMatrixSet
member.summary:
WMTS uses a tile matrix set to split the map into equal sized squares at different zoom levels. Such a square (so-called tile) is a matrix image which contains geographic data. So a map is cut into multiple tiles according to a fixed scale, which is called a tile matrix. Multiple matrices can be defined for different resolutions, resulting in a tile matrix set composed of one or more tile matrices. Each tile matrix uses a tile matrix identifier, commonly the position of the matrix in the set, the layer with the lowest resolution to be Layer 0. Further details can be seen here. The used tile matrix set by a service can be determined via the WMTS capabilities request. In the example shown for URL template the following tile matrix set was extracted from the capabilities http://laermkartierung1.eisenbahn-bundesamt.de/mb3/WMTSCapabilities.xml:
new TileMatrixSet("EPSG:25832") { new TileMatrix("00", 12980398.9955000000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 1, 1), new TileMatrix("01", 6490199.4977700000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 2, 2), new TileMatrix("02", 3245099.7488800000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 4, 4), new TileMatrix("03", 1622549.8744400000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 7, 8), new TileMatrix("04", 811274.9372210000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 14, 16), new TileMatrix("05", 405637.4686100000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 28, 32), new TileMatrix("06", 202818.7343050000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 56, 64), new TileMatrix("07", 101409.3671530000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 111, 128), new TileMatrix("08", 50704.6835763000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 222, 256), new TileMatrix("09", 25352.3417882000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 443, 512), new TileMatrix("10", 12676.1708941000, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 885, 1024), new TileMatrix("11", 6338.0854470400, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 1770, 2048), new TileMatrix("12", 3169.0427235200, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 3540, 4096), new TileMatrix("13", 1584.5213617600, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 7080, 8192), new TileMatrix("14", 792.2606808800, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 14160, 16384), new TileMatrix("15", 396.1303404400, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 28320, 32768), new TileMatrix("16", 198.0651702200, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 56639, 65536), new TileMatrix("17", 99.0325851100, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 113278, 131072), new TileMatrix("18", 49.5162925550, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 226555, 262144), new TileMatrix("19", 24.7581462775, 204485.0, 6134557.0, 453109, 524288) };

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.SelectTileMatrixDelegate
member.summary: Defines a function that determines the best matching tile matrix for rendering a map image with the given logical bounds and image size. This delegate is used by WmtsMapService to decouple the service from the full tile matrix set. Being used by WmtsMapService, the CRS of the bounding box passed in is the very same as the CRS that has been passed to the WmtsMapService during initialization. To be quite clear in the logic to implement, the CRS will not be repeated as a parameter in the call to the delegate.
member.param: The logical bounds of the map image to be rendered.
The image size of the map to be rendered.
member.returns: The best matching tile matrix represented by an implementation of ITileMatrix.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.WmtsMapService
member.summary: MapService implementation that turns a WMTS service into a WMS-like service allowing arbitrary map sections and zoom levels to be requested.

member.name: F:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.WmtsMapService.SizeLimit
member.summary:
Both size and bounding box passed to GetImageStream below have been determined by multiple transformations. With some CRSes being restricted geographically, the actual values of size a/o bounding box may be invalid. As a simple check for that, we use the value of SizeLimit to check if pixels sizes are in a valid range.
TODO: Improve the size check and move it to the caller of GetImageStream.

member.name: F:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.WmtsMapService.tileCache
member.summary: Setup a tile cache to cache up to 16MiB of WMTS tile data. This cache is used by LoadImage below.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.WmtsMapService.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.WmtsLayer.SelectTileMatrixDelegate,Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.IBoundingBox)
member.summary: Creates and initializes an instance of WmtsMapService.
member.param: The template for settings up the URLs for requesting tiles. See remarks below.
The CRS of the WMTS service we're calling.
A function determining the best matching tile matrix for a given rendering request.
Optionally defines the limits of the MapService in EPSG:76131.
member.remarks: The url template is expected to contain the placeholders "{x}", "{y}" and "{z}", e.g. "http://mywmts.service.de/wmts/mylayer/mymatrixset/{z}/{x}/{y}.png". The placeholders will be replaced when requesting tiles; the value of "{z}" will be taken from the identifier of the tile matrix actually returned by the given SelectTileMatrixDelegate. Each web request created will be passed to a delegate that allows additional modifications.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.FeatureLayers.TimeConsiderationScenario
member.summary: Time consideration scenario which should be used when the map is rendered and map objects are retrieved. Currently supported scenarios are OptimisticTimeConsideration, SnapshotTimeConsideration and TimeSpanConsideration. For all other return values (including null string), no scenario is used and all time dependent features are not relevant.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.FeatureLayers.ReferenceTime
member.summary: For SnapshotTimeConsideration and TimeSpanConsideration it is necessary to define a reference time to determine which time dependent features should be active or not. The reference time including a time zone comes along in the following format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss[+-]HH:mm, for example 2018-08-05T04:00:00+02:00.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.FeatureLayers.TimeSpan
member.summary: Time span (in seconds) which is added to the reference time and needed for the TimeSpanConsideration scenario.

member.summary: Generates layer objects based on xServer 2.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.LayerFactory.#ctor(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.IXServerVersion)

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.LayerFactory.BaseUrl
member.summary: URL specifying the root part of the URL from which a service like rendering a map can be composed. For example, https://xserver2-europe-eu-test.cloud.ptvgroup.com can be used as a base URL providing access to a Cloud based XServer2 system. The renderMap service is composed to: https://xserver2-europe-eu-test.cloud.ptvgroup.com/services/rs/XMap/{version}/renderMap

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.LayerFactory.Token
member.summary: For xServer internet, a token must be specified for authentication.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.LayerFactory.BackgroundLayer
member.summary: An object providing a tile-based (i.e. more responsive) rendering. The geographical content is defined by the list of background themes, see . This layer object should be inserted in a before the .

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.LayerFactory.BackgroundThemes
member.summary: Collection of themes which determine the geographical content of the , for example themes like background or transport.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.LayerFactory.LabelLayer
member.summary: An object providing an untiled rendering, the whole map is comprised in a single bitmap. The geographical content is defined by the list of foreground themes, see . This layer object should be inserted in a after the .

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.LayerFactory.LabelThemes
member.summary: Collection of themes which determine the geographical content for the , for example themes like labels or PTV_TruckAttributes. The major intention of this layer is to avoid blurred objects like texts or traffic signs when fractional rendering is applied. Fractional rendering is provided by the object allowing seamless zooming. In most mapping frameworks there are only zoom levels available according the classification of tile sizes. Only in such environments a tile-based rendering is recommended.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.LayerFactory.MapLanguage
member.summary: Function which returns the language, used for geographical objects in the map like names for town and streets. The language code is defined in BCP47, for example en, fr or de.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.LayerFactory.UserLanguage
member.summary: The language used for textual messages, for example provided by the theme traffic incidents. The language code is defined in BCP47, for example en, fr or de.

member.summary: All available map styles configured on the corresponding xMap2 server.

member.summary: Style of a map.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Layers.Xmap2.UntiledProvider
member.summary: Loads untiled bitmaps from a given xServer 2 URL, like http://xserver-2:40000/services/rs/XMap/renderMap. Its main purpose is to get labels from xServer 2, which shows a proper rendering of textual objects independent from the current scale. By means of tiled access some unpleasant artifacts may occur when fractional rendering is used. With untiled rendering this issue can be avoided.

summary.para: A map is built-up with different . There are several types of layers. The main types are , which renders map content split-up in bitmap tiles, , which renders a new image whenever the map viewport changes and , which can be used to display dynamic vector data. The map control has a to add, remove and manipulate the order and visibility of layers.

summary.para: For geographical use cases, the type is insufficient for different reasons. Especially the convention, the top value contains a lower coordinate value compared to the bottom value, often leads to implementing issues. Therefore, this class provides the compass directions as bounding properties directly.
Another aspect is the paradigm of a center based reference point (compared to the edge-based format of type ).

member.summary: Internal helper for setting all boundary values at once.
member.returns: The object itself is returned, so it can be reused in the same line of code.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, by setting all boundaries to an empty state. This approach is helpful, when objects are inserted by the Union methods.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.#ctor(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, by copying the boundaries of parameter .
member.param: Original rectangle providing all values for the new instance.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.#ctor(System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, by transforming the location and size of parameter into boundaries of the new instance.
member.param: Rectangle providing the boundaries of the new instance.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.#ctor(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, by setting the and boundaries to .X, as well as the and boundaries to .Y. Therefore, the and properties have a value of 0.
member.param: This point is used for defining the boundaries of the new instance.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.#ctor(System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. The resulting object represents the smallest rectangle containing both points, i.e. both points define the boundaries directly. The ordering of the parameters has no influence on the result.
member.param: First point contained in the rectangle.
Second point contained in the rectangle.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Windows.Point})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. The resulting object represents the smallest rectangle containing all points provided by the point enumeration, i.e. the new object represents the minimal bounding rectangle of the point collection. The ordering of the points inside the enumeration has no influence on the result.
member.param: Enumeration of points, which are included in the new instance in a minimal way. An enumeration with no points results in an empty rectangle.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.#ctor(System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. The resulting object is defined by the and parameter.
member.param: Point defining the center of the rectangle.
Size defining the width and height of the rectangle.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, by setting the boundaries directly. No checks are made for avoiding a lower value compared to the value. The same is true for the / pair.
member.remarks: The ordering of the parameters follows the scheme lower horizontal boundary - higher horizontal boundary - lower vertical boundary - higher vertical boundary.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the rectangle is empty. This is true, if the width or height value is lower 0.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.West
member.summary: Gets or sets the West boundary of the rectangle. The rectangle is empty, if the value is higher than the boundary value. No checks are made to avoid a higher value compared to the boundary.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.East
member.summary: Gets or sets the East boundary of the rectangle. The rectangle is empty, if the value is lower than the boundary value. No checks are made to avoid a lower value compared to the boundary.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.South
member.summary: Gets or sets the South boundary of the rectangle. The rectangle is empty, if the value is higher than the boundary value. No checks are made to avoid a higher value compared to the boundary.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.North
member.summary: Gets or sets the North boundary of the rectangle. The rectangle is empty, if the value is lower than the boundary value. No checks are made to avoid a higher value compared to the boundary.

member.summary: Gets the SouthWest point of the rectangle.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.SouthEast
member.summary: Gets the SouthEast point of the rectangle.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.NorthWest
member.summary: Gets the NorthWest point of the rectangle.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.NorthEast
member.summary: Gets the NorthEast point of the rectangle.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the rectangle. If the width is set, the rectangle's center remains the same.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the rectangle. If the height is set, the rectangle's center remains the same.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.Center
member.summary: Gets or sets the center of the rectangle. If the rectangle is empty, the point (Double.NaN, Double.NaN) is returned. If the center is set to an empty rectangle, the value becomes the new center, the width and height of the rectangle are set to 0. If the rectangle was not empty, the center is changed, but the width and height remain unchanged.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.Contains(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Checks whether the parameter is within the rectangle, inclusive its edges.
member.param: The point which is being tested for containment.
member.returns: If the rectangle is empty, the check always returns false. Otherwise it returns true, if the parameter is within the rectangle, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.Contains(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle)
member.summary: Checks whether the parameter is located completely within the rectangle, inclusive its edges.
member.param: The rectangle which is being tested for containment.
member.returns: If the object is empty, the check always returns false. Otherwise, if parameter is empty, the check returns true (an empty rectangle is always located in a non-empty rectangle). Otherwise it returns true, if the is located completely within the rectangle, false otherwise.

member.summary: Checks whether the parameter intersects with this rectangle. If one edge is coincident, it is considered an intersection.
member.param: The rectangle which is being tested for intersection.
member.returns: Returns true if the MapRect intersects with this rectangle, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.Intersect(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle)
member.summary: Updates this rectangle to be the intersection of this and parameter . If either this or are empty, the result is empty as well.
member.param: The rect to intersect with this.
member.returns: The object itself is returned, so it can be reused in the same line of code.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.Union(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Updates this rectangle to be the union of this and parameter . I.e. the rectangle boundaries and the point itself are included in the new boundaries. If has Double.IsNaN coordinates, the boundaries remain unchanged. If this is empty, the boundaries are adapted to the point's coordinates (width and height will be 0).
member.param: The point to 'incorporate' into this object.
member.returns: The object itself is returned, so it can be reused in the same line of code.

member.summary: Unifies the rectangle and . If has Double.IsNaN coordinates, the resulting rectangle has the same values as . If is empty, the boundaries of the resulting rectangle are adapted to the point's coordinates (width and height will be 0).
member.returns: Unified rectangle returned as a new instance.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.Union(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle)
member.summary: Updates this rectangle to be the union of this and parameter . I.e. the rectangle boundaries of this and are included in the new boundaries. If is empty, the boundaries remain unchanged. If this is empty, the new boundaries are adapted to the 's boundaries.
member.param: The rectangle to 'incorporate' into this object.
member.returns: The object itself is returned, so it can be reused in the same line of code.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.Translate(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Translates the rectangle horizontally and vertically, if it is not empty. All boundaries are changed.
member.param: Amount of horizontal translation, positive values shifts the rectangle eastwards, negative values westwards.
Amount of vertical translation, positive values shifts the rectangle northwards, negative values southwards.
member.returns: The object itself is returned, so it can be reused in the same line of code.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.op_Addition(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Translates the rectangle parameter horizontally and vertically, if it is not empty. All its boundaries are changed.
member.param: The rectangle which is the origin of the translate operation.

The X-value specifies the amount of horizontal translation, positive values shifts the rectangle eastwards, negative values westwards. The Y-value specifies the amount of vertical translation, positive values shifts the rectangle northwards, negative values southwards.
member.returns: The translated object is returned as a new instance.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.InflateHorizontally(System.Double)
member.summary: Inflates the object horizontally by specifying a factor. The width of the rectangle is multiplied by this factor.

member.returns: The object itself is returned, so it can be reused in the same line of code.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.InflateVertically(System.Double)

member.returns: The object itself is returned, so it can be reused in the same line of code.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.Inflate(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Inflates the object horizontally and vertically by specifying two different factors for each dimension. The width and height of the rectangle is multiplied by these factors.
member.param: Factor which specifies the new value of the property .
Factor which specifies the new value of the property .
member.returns: The object itself is returned, so it can be reused in the same line of code.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.Inflate(System.Double)
member.summary: Inflates the object horizontally and vertically by specifying one single factor, applied to both dimensions. The width and height of the rectangle is multiplied by this factor.
member.param: Factor which specifies the new value of the property and .
member.returns: The object itself is returned, so it can be reused in the same line of code.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle.op_Multiply(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapRectangle,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Inflates the object horizontally and vertically by specifying two different factors for each dimension. The width and height of the rectangle is multiplied by these factors.

The X-value specifies the new value of the property , whereas the Y-value specifies the new value of the property .

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Symbols.LightenColorExtension
member.summary: Documentation in progress...

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Symbols.LightenColorExtension.Lighten(System.Windows.Media.Color,System.Single)
member.summary: This method applies lighting to a color including keeping the transparency. For instance, a color that has a lighting factor of 1 applies, appears at its original value. A color with a lighting factor of 0.5 appears only half as bright as it was before. A color with a lighting factor of 1.5 appears roughly twice as bright as before. A color with a lightning factor of 2 appears white.
member.param: Amount of light applied to the color.
member.remarks: This routine is very fast. Even when using it in tight loops, it is not possible to measure a significant amount of time spent in this routine (always less than 1 millisecond). Originally concerned about the performance of this, a caching mechanism was added, but that slowed things down by 2 orders of magnitude.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.LineReductionClipping.PolylineBuilder`1.Append(System.Windows.Point,System.Boolean,System.Windows.Point,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Appends the line specified by p0 and p1 to the polyline. The given points are added only if necessary; that is, if their corresponding pixel coordinates differ from the pixel coordinates of the tail of the polyline. Setting either force_p0 or force_p1 to true forces the points to be added without further checks.
member.param: Specifies if p0 is to be added without further checks.
Specifies if p1 is to be added without further checks.

member.summary: Gets the resulting polylines, after appending several single lines using Append.

member.summary: Append a point without further checks.

member.summary: Begin a new polyline and append the point without further checks.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.LineReductionClipping.PolylineBuilder`1.Append(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.LineReductionClipping.PolylineBuilder{`0}.AppendCheck,System.Windows.Size,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Appends the given point to the current polyline, also updating the end point of the current polyline. Certain conditions apply before the point is added; see also parameter description.
member.param: Flag indicating if the given point is to be added without further checks or if the given threshold is to be evaluated.
If appendCheck is set to AppendCheck.EvaluateThreshold, the given point must differ from the current end point by this threshold before it is added to the polyline.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.LineReductionClipping.PolylineBuilder`1.IsDifferent(System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Helper method indicating if the two input points are regarded as different according the provided size threshold.
member.param: First of two points to check for threshold difference.
Second of two points to check for threshold difference.
Threshold values for x and y coordinates. The difference of both points is compared against these threshold values.
member.returns: True if one of x or y difference is larger than the corresponding threshold value.

summary.para: This namespace contains tool classes for support.
The class contains methods to transform from world to map and screen coordinates.
The and classes contain methods to convert an OGC well-known-binary byte array to GDI and WPF geometry types.
The class can be used to reduce the number of points for complex line string. This can be used to display large routes for the vector layer.
The class can be used to implement a clustering mechanism for a large amount of map locations.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.Adler32
member.summary:
Adler-32 checksum calculation, initially taken from here: http://www.java2s.com/Code/CSharp/Security/ComputesAdler32checksumforastreamofdata.htm
----- original description ------------------------------------------------------------------
Computes Adler32 checksum for a stream of data. An Adler32 checksum is not as reliable as a CRC32 checksum, but a lot faster to compute.
The specification for Adler32 may be found in RFC 1950. ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification version 3.3)
From that document:
"ADLER32 (Adler-32 checksum) This contains a checksum value of the uncompressed data (excluding any dictionary data) computed according to Adler-32 algorithm. This algorithm is a 32-bit extension and improvement of the Fletcher algorithm, used in the ITU-T X.224 / ISO 8073 standard.
Adler-32 is composed of two sums accumulated per byte: s1 is the sum of all bytes, s2 is the sum of all s1 values. Both sums are done modulo 65521. s1 is initialized to 1, s2 to zero. The Adler-32 checksum is stored as s2*65536 + s1 in most- significant-byte first (network) order."
"8.2. The Adler-32 algorithm
The Adler-32 algorithm is much faster than the CRC32 algorithm yet still provides an extremely low probability of undetected errors.
The modulo on unsigned long accumulators can be delayed for 5552 bytes, so the modulo operation time is negligible. If the bytes are a, b, c, the second sum is 3a + 2b + c + 3, and so is position and order sensitive, unlike the first sum, which is just a checksum. That 65521 is prime is important to avoid a possible large class of two-byte errors that leave the check unchanged. (The Fletcher checksum uses 255, which is not prime and which also makes the Fletcher check insensitive to single byte changes 0 - 255.)
The sum s1 is initialized to 1 instead of zero to make the length of the sequence part of s2, so that the length does not have to be checked separately. (Any sequence of zeroes has a Fletcher checksum of zero.)"

member.summary: largest prime smaller than 65536

member.summary: Class encapsulating a service that delivers map images.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.MapService.MinAlignment
member.summary: Defines the position of (MinX|MinY) in images returned by this service.
member.remarks:
The alignment is a required parameter when resulting map images must be re-projected. Usually the alignment will be ContentAlignment.BottomLeft, as many rectangles follow the rules "Left < Right" and "Top > Bottom". ContentAlignment.BottomLeft is also the value returned by the default implementation and you usually do not need to change that.
Unfortunately the alignment cannot be determined dynamically on the client side without knowing how services actually map logical coordinates to pixels. Without services returning the actually rendered map rectangle in their response (as PTV xMap Server e.g. does, as WMS services don't), this value must explicitly be configured for re-projections to work properly.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.ReprojectionOptions.InterpolationMode
member.summary: Controls the interpolation mode when re-projecting pixels.
member.remarks: Defaults to InterpolationMode.Bicubic.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.ReprojectionOptions.BlockSize
member.summary: The block size (width/height) for which linear interpolation applies.
member.remarks:
Defaults to 32.
Mapping target to source pixels is considered an expensive operation requiring multiple transformations on both, pixel and logical coordinates. Being expensive, re-projection uses this mapping only to calculate a grid consisting of supporting points, while applying a linear interpolation for intermediate points (point withing a grid block). The parameter blockSize determines both width and height of a single cell.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.ReprojectionServiceOptions.SourceBoundsSupportingPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of the supporting points that are used when determining the source bounding box.

member.name: P:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.ReprojectionServiceOptions.SourceSizeFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the factor used for determining the size of the images requested from the inner map service.
member.remarks:
When re-projection applies, the size of the images requested from the inner WMS map services must be determined in a way to allow re-projection to produce high quality results. However, as the source and target aspect ratio may differ significantly, it is not quite easy to determine a viable source size.
The general idea is to base the source size calculations on an amount pixels, which can simply be transformed into the source size via the aspect ratio of the source bounding box. Based on the request target size, we can determine a minimum and maximum source size using the shortest and the longest side of the target rectangle as the base in the calculation. The minimum and maximum size then can be transformed into a minimum and maximum pixel amount which, using the value of sourceSizeFactor, can in turn be transformed into the final source amount of pixels.
If sourceSizeFactor contains a positive value, the source size will be determined as described above: source = min + (max - min)*sourceSizeFactor.
If sourceSizeFactor is invalid (or null) the source amount of pixels will be set to equal the target amount of pixels: source = target.
If sourceSizeFactor is negative, its absolute value will be multiplied with the target amount of pixels: source = target * sourceSizeFactor.

member.name: F:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.WmsMapService.OnRequestCreated
member.summary: Additional event that will be triggered after the request has been created. Used for request customization.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.WmsMapService.#ctor(System.String,System.Drawing.ContentAlignment,Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.WmsPlaceholders)
member.summary: Creates and initializes an instance of WmsMapService.
member.param: The URL template is expected to include an SRS/CRS parameter. It defines placeholders for bounding box, image width and height.
Position of (MinX|MinY) in resulting images. Defaults to ContentAlignment.BottomLeft. Refer to MinAlignment for details.
Defines the placeholder names. May be null to use the internal defaults.
member.exception: Fails with an ArgumentException if the url template misses mandatory elements or if the specified alignment is set to an unsupported value (such as ContentAlignment.MiddleCenter).

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.WmsMapService.InstantiateUrl(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.IBoundingBox,System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a url using the internal template, given the request parameters that replace the placeholders in the template.
member.returns: Instantiated url that can be used to request the actual map image.
member.remarks: Derived classes may override this method to customize the url being used for requesting map images.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.Reprojection.WmsMapService.CreateRequest(System.String)
member.summary: Creates and initializes the WebRequest that requests the map image.
member.param: The URL for the requested map image, as returned by InstantiateUrl.
member.remarks: Derived classes may override this method to customize the web request being used for requesting map images.

member.summary: The .NET version 3.5 does not support easing. Therefore, we implement basic easing support in here. We also implement an own DoubleAnimation providing easing. There's a compiler switch, FAKE_EASING, with which we can assure to use to framework classes starting with .NET 4.0.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.XMapMetaInfo.SetCredentials(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Setting credential parameters for HTTP authentication, which are necessary for an xServer configuration running in an Azure environment. After registering in the Customer Centre, you received your personal account data. This data needed for authentication consists of the username, password and a token. Meanwhile the username and password is needed for every authentication aspect, the token is restricted to programming reasons. We recommend to use the token only in your further development steps.
member.remarks: Further details can be found in http://xserver.ptvgroup.com/de/cookbook/getting-started .
member.param: User name of the HTTP authentication. In combination with the usage of the token, this parameter has to be set to 'xtok'.
Password of the HTTP authentication. The token value can be used here in combination with the user 'xtok'.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.XMapMetaInfo.CheckCredentials(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checking credential parameters for HTTP authentication, which are necessary for an xServer configuration running in an Azure environment. After registering in the Customer Centre, you received your personal account data. This data needed for authentication consists of the username, password and a token. Meanwhile the username and password is needed for every authentication aspect, the token is restricted to programming reasons. We recommend to use the token only in your further development steps.
member.param: User name of the HTTP authentication. In combination with the usage of the token, this parameter has to be set to 'xtok'.
Password of the HTTP authentication. The token value can be used here in combination with the user 'xtok'.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.XMapTools.AreXMapLayersAvailable(System.String,System.String,xserver.Layer[],System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checks if one or n certain layers are available or not.
member.param: The url to the XMap instance.
The used context key or null if none is used.
The profile used to check the availability.

The expected error code if the at least one layer does not exist. SoapExceptions carrying this error code will be caught and the return value of the method will be false. SoapExceptions carrying another error code will not be caught and thus be thrown by this API.
User name needed for Azure Cloud.
member.returns: True if one or n layers are available, false if at least one layer is not available. May throw exceptions in case of malformed url or wrong contextKey definition.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.XServerUrl
member.summary: Helper class for converting URL address into the correct format.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.XServerUrl.Complete(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
To access the functionality provided by the XServer's web services, a URL has to be specified, which has to fulfill some constraints.
At first, according to the concrete xServer (for example xMap), the URL has to look like (scheme)://(host):(port)/xmap/ws/XMap, especially the path with its mixed uppercase and lower case characters. If no scheme is specified in the input URL, then a completion is started, concerning an adequate value for this scheme, a check for an xServer internet deployed XServer and eventually insertion of the default port, if no one is specifed in the input URL.
If the scheme (or protocol) like http is missing in the URL, then this method examines the host for an xServer internet-like name. The host indicates an Azure XServer, if it contains some characters followed by a '-', followed by one of the letters 'h', 'n' or 't'. Optionally, the module name may precede this construct, and the texts '-test' or '-integration' may follow also optionally. The path is completely ignored. The scheme is set to https, if an xServer internet host name is detected, otherwise http is used. The following URLs will all be transformed to https://xmap-eu-n.cloud.ptvgroup.com/xmap/ws/XMap : eu-n, xmap-eu-n, eu-n.cloud.ptvgroup.com xmap-eu-n.cloud.ptvgroup.com
If a port is part of the URL, it will be used, except an xServer internet host is detected (then the port is completely ignored). If no scheme and no port is specified (and no xServer internet host is detected), then a default port-assignment is used.
member.param: Eventually partial specified URL needed for XServer's web services, for example 'eu-n-test' or 'http://localhost:50010'.
Name of the XServer module, like XMap or XRoute. The casing is corrected according the internal requirements.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.XServerUrl.IsXServerInternet(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the provided URL address is an XServer deployed in an XServer Internet environment.
member.param: URL to check for xServer internet deployment.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.XServerUrl.IsDecartaBackend(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the provided URL addresses uses a DeCarta backend.
member.param: URL to check for xServer internet deployment.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Tools.XServerUrl.Port(System.String)
member.summary: Matches a module name to the corresponding port. For example, 'xmap' results in a return value of 50010, which represents the default port number, commonly used for XMap.
member.param: Name of the mode, for example 'XMap' or 'XRoute'.
member.returns: Default port number of the module specified in

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Canvases.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: A canvas holds the graphic items of a map. One or more canvases are used for a layer. There are two main types of canvases: A , whose elements have positions and dimensions in world Mercator units and a , whose elements have positions and dimensions in screen (pixel) units. By using multiple canvases, the elements for different layers can interleave for different types.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Canvases.ScreenCanvas
member.summary: Canvas with screen coordinates. Elements of the canvas have an absolute dimension (= size in pixels) but have to be repositioned whenever the viewport changes.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The instance of the parent map.

member.name: M:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Canvases.ScreenCanvas.#ctor(Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.MapView,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. If the second parameter is set to true, the new screen canvas is added to the parent map.
member.param: The instance of the parent map.
Indicates that the canvas should be inserted to the parent map immediately.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Canvases.WorldCanvas
member.summary: Canvas with world coordinates. Elements of the canvas do not have to be repositioned when the viewport changes, but have world-dimension (= size in Mercator units).

summary.para: The namespace contains the classes to visualize your data in an interactive map.

The main type is the , which can be added to a XAML user control. An alternative can be used for easy WinForms integration. Both controls inherit from and implement . The Map type can be used to build up a customized map control.

member.name: T:Ptv.XServer.Controls.Map.Map
member.summary: This class represents the basic map control without any gadgets. It is used as the WPFMap's base class, and as a proxy for the WinForms map control. So, it is possible to provide a common implementation for both environments, i.e. WPF and WinForms.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the built-in PTV theme should be used, and thus overriding an optionally set style. The application theme can be set in the App.xaml. If no theme at all is set and the default PTV theme is not used either, the UI will look like the current Windows theme.
See the topic for an example.

member.name: T:TinyJson.JSONParser
member.summary: Really simple JSON parser which attempts to parse JSON files with minimal GC allocation Attempts are made to NOT throw an exception if the JSON is corrupted or invalid: returns null instead. Only public fields and property setters on classes/structs will be written to. Parsing of abstract classes or interfaces is NOT supported and will throw an exception.

member.summary: Transforms a JSON string into the object of type T.
member.typeparam: Type to which the JSON string is converted.

member.summary: Really simple JSON writer which outputs JSON structures from an object.

member.name: M:TinyJson.JSONWriter.ToJson(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts an object to a JSON string representation.
member.param: Object which should be converted to a JSON string representation.
member.returns: JSON string representation of the input object.
